subtitle: Stuffed vegetables are a great speciality of the Middle Eastern cuisine. These tomatoes contain delicious dried fruit and bulgar wheat stuffing, flavoured with mild and aromatic spices and fresh mint.

method.text: Slice the tops off the tomatoes. Scoop out the seeds and some of the pulp and chop.
Place the bulgar wheat in a bowl. Pour over the stock. Cover and leave to stand for 10 min.
Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onion, garlic and mushrooms for 5 min. Next, stir in courgette and spices and stir over the heat for 2 min.
Add the tomato flesh and tomato puree and cook until the tomato has broken down.
Mix in the bulgar wheat with the remaining ingredients and seasoning.
Use the mixture to stuff the tomatoes. Place close together in a small baking dish. Bake in the oven for 40 min or until the tomatoes are just tender. Serve hot.

title: Middle Eastern stuffed tomatoes
